head.title: A Faster Way: New Helicopter Service to Machu Picchu

hedline.hl1: A Faster Way: New Helicopter Service to Machu Picchu
hedline.hl2: A Faster Way: New Helicopter Service to Machu Picchu

block.p: For 400 years, it took days on foot to reach the ancient Inca citadel of Machu Picchu. Then, about a century ago, travelers were offered the option of taking a four-hour train ride instead. Now there's yet another way.

Inkaterra, a Peruvian ecotourism company, started a helicopter service from Cuzco to Machu Picchu in May. The 30-minute flight whisks passengers to the helipad at the Machu Picchu Pueblo Hotel, about a 20-minute drive from the ruins. Rates begin at $895 a person for a one-day excursion, based on the number of passengers, and include a guided tour of the ruins and lunch at the hotel. Overnight trips are also available.

Another company had offered helicopter flights, but the government wouldn't renew its contract because of complaints by environmentalists and local residents about noise and pollution.
Inkaterra said it uses five-passenger low-noise Alouette helicopters on its flights. To make reservations, call (800) 442-5042 or visit www.inkaterra.com.
